post_text: There have been numerous modifications designed and developed over the summer months to ensure our schools and classrooms are safe for students and staff to return to after being away for five months. From classroom desk partitions, plexiglass partitions in common areas, socially distant floorplans and seating charts to one-way hallways, there seems to be a change to almost everything (and we only mentioned a few of them)! These changes did not happen overnight - a lot of hard work to re-open our buildings safely has been put in by all. We want to say THANK YOU to the staff members who have gone the extra mile and worked incredibly hard to prepare our buildings' for a safe return later this week. (Not to mention the hard work put in by the custodial staff who have done a deep clean of all buildings!) We can't wait to see everyone on Thursday or Friday!

The application process for the Sioux Falls School District Virtual Academy (SFSDVA) is officially open!

Parents/guardians may voluntarily elect for their child to participate in the web-based curriculum during the 2020-2021 school year. SFSDVA is tuition-free. A Sioux Falls School District teacher will monitor student progress, respond to questions, and assess the learning of your child.

The SFSDVA is an additional educational option other than a traditional brick-and-mortar school setting. The Academy provides students with opportunities to work online and either submit or upload, daily work as they move through the lessons. Families will receive a weekly schedule of content and activities that provide students an opportunity to practice the necessary skills to move to the next grade level.

Applications are due online or in-person to the Instructional Planning Center, 201 E. 38th Street, by Monday, August 3, 2020.

We love our students - and we miss them when they're not in school! Please help protect them from influenza and other related illnesses by following these simple guidelines:

*A child with a fever over 100 degrees shall not be sent to school. The child must stay home until the fever has been gone for 24 hours without the use of fever reducing medication such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen. (Please do not give your child medication and send them to school in an effort to make it through the day.)

*Children with illness related vomiting and diarrhea should be kept home. A child should be free from vomiting and diarrhea for several hours and be able to keep food down before returning to school.

Remember it's not too late to vaccinate! Talk to you healthcare provider about getting a flu shot! Cover your cough and wash your hands! Eat healthy and get plenty of sleep!
